result.execSummary:
The defendant Romel L Grant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $23.00 payable to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.

Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable Court costs, fees and surcharges and restitution.  All to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: *8/25/2016  No contact with children under the age of 18 except the defendant's own children.

Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation. Follow any recommended treatment.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
--Defendant must comply with the permanent sex offender reporting requirement.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Romel L Grant in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Romel L Grant in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by the victims' parents, Mary S. and Duane S.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit given for 230 days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with children under the age of 18.
* Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $23.00 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Fund.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant must comply with the PERMANENT sex offender reporting requirement.

  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Romel L Grant not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

PER THE PERMISSION OF JUDGE DONALD, CLERK ADJOURNED TODAY'S SENTENCING HEARING OFF THE RECORD.

Parties unable to proceed with a sentencing hearing today.
Atty. Anderson is in trial in another court.
Also, Judge Donald is in trial on an unrelated matter.

Case adjourned to 01-07-2016 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.
Copy of payment made by the Crime Victim Compensation Program to the victim; filed.
to Judge Donald; from the defendant - filed.

Defendant Romel L Grant in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Romel L Grant in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Case adjourned to 12-17-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Romel L Grant not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

PER THE PERMISSION OF JUDGE DONALD AND HIS UNAVAILABILITY TODAY, CLERK ADJOURNED TODAY'S PLEA HEARING DATE OFF THE RECORD.

Judge Donald is attending a funeral out of state today.
Case adjourned to 11-09-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea Hearing.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Romel L Grant not in court, in custody.  
Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter before the Court for Final Pre-trial.  Parties have been engaged in negotiations; defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Case adjourned for plea hearing before Branch 2; date selected.  Case to remain set for jury trial at this time.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Parties request a Jury Trial date.

Attorney Scott F. Anderson in court, defendant Romel L Grant not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State has received the lab report on the toxicology and was sent to the defense.  However, the report on the DNA has not been completed.   

Per Chief Judge Directive of 15-10, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Branch 02, Judge Joseph Donald, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Scott F. Anderson in court. Defendant Romel L. Grant not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel waived to defendant's appearance for the purpose of today's proceedings. The State informed that Court that is still has not received the DNA report. Defense counsel was willing to set final pre-trial and jury trial dates, but parties agreed on an additional pre-trial conference to allow time for the DNA report to be completed. State to follow-up with the appropriate parties to obtain the report. Case adjourned to Branch 44.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection, Received and Filed

Attorney Scott F. Anderson in court, defendant Romel L Grant not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Bail argued by counsel.  Court denies motion to reduce the bail.   Defense has received defendant's statement and an offer.  Defense needs time to review the offer with his client.  State advises the defense there may be DNA evidence.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Mtoion and Motion for Bail Modification received and filed./ds

Attorney Scott F. Anderson in court, defendant Romel L Grant not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State has not received the DVD of the statement and needs to provide it to the defense.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Romel L Grant in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Romel L Grant in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AMS dob 2/2/02 her residence or her family

Defendant Romel L Grant in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Romel L Grant in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
